intro: Tavaresia × meintjesii, commonly known as the hybrid tavaresia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a hybrid species resulting from the cross between Tavaresia steyermarkii and Tavaresia meintjesii, both native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, fragrant white to pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated by gardeners interested in rare and exotic plants.
